Reviews.Title: “Big value for small room.”
Reviews.Author: Skyrocketbilly
Reviews.Content: The bedroom was small but very functional. A little weird when you see the shower in the main room. Thankfully the toilet is partitioned from the main room. I loved their breakfasts. I wish all continental breakfasts were this good. Wifi seemed reliable and staff were very helpful. Hotel is a short 10-15 min walk from Gare de Nord train station (if you are arriving by train) and is on top of Gare d'lest and Chateau Landon trains stations.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel. Fine for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: bubwal
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel just a 10 min walk from Gare du Nord and overlooks Gare de l'est. Don't expect "luxury" of course and the hotel is used as "one night stop" for tourists as part of a european tour. The hotel is quiet and despite our room over looking the platforms of the station you could not here a thing with the windows closed, so you won't be disturbed. The free in room wireless is superb and the breakfast is average continental fare and does the job fine. Free tea and coffee is available until 10pm but note they do not provide milk, despite instant coffee and english breakfast tea being served. What let this hotel down was the general service at reception. While there was a queue of around 5 people, only one person was dealing with customers buy yet there were 3 other members of staff stood in reception not doing anything at all. The beds in the rooms and the pillows also seem to have had their day. The mattress is hard and the beds are not attached to the headboard so the beds tend to move. Fine fore a few nights but I have stayed in the same star hotels in Paris, which have been better and for the same price. It would not be a first choice in Paris, but the hotel overall was fine and clean

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marty1962
Reviews.Content: Great value with breakfast included and free WI-fi. Location near two major train stations- short walk- and Metro station entrance right nice door. Fast check-in. Room compact but acceptable and bed very comfortable. Breakfast is very good once you figure out whats what! Staff very good at all times. Nice touch with the Kitkat and water on the table each day! The free drinks area is OK. Check out was fast too. Good clean budget hotel in an area handy for public transport. Oh yes,the decor in the 'bar' area is so bright you wouldn't want to drink there so BYO at the shops across the road!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JamesV92
Reviews.Content: magnificent choice for anyone visitng paris and if you're going for the first time. it's a great price and includes breakfast and I found the room to be very good and the bed more than comfortable. What makes it such a good option is its proximity to the metro, with there being a station literally adjacent to the hotel. I travelled to Paris by Eurostar and this is a quick walk from Gare du Nord station so I would recommend this to other Eurostar passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: textilesrus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights not expecting much as it was so reasonable for Paris. A very pleasant surprise awaited us in a good sized room with avery comfortable bed, largish bathroom, friendly staff and a breakfast that for Paris was generous all in the price. Would definitely recommend to price conscious travellers. Save your pennies for a good meal out instead!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Justine H
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size for four people. King size bed & two singles, clean and modern, The breakfast was absolutely delicious and plenty of it. We walked everywhere from the hotel but the train station is right next door, so getting anywhere was not a problem. There are a couple of little supermarkets across the road and lots of places to eat also. The turkish was great and very cheap:-). I would definately stay at another All Seasons just for the breakfast alone. We saved money on lunch as breakfast was so huge it filled us up for the day!! I highly reccomend for families looking for a great deal. You save a lot of money being a little out of the heart of Paris but as mentioned already we walked everywhere (30mins) or the trains are right next door. Just one other thing...we booked and paid for out trip to Disneyland before we left, but found it would have been muich cheaper to do it whilst there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: Kanyakoch
Reviews.Content: The metro station is beside this hotel, very convenient to access everywhere. My room's window is turning back to Gare de L'Est station so a bit noisy but not serious. I stayed here for 5 nights with almost fine except the 4th night. There was electrical problem (light off) on my floor and it took about 3 hours to recover. The manager on that night did nothing but only nod his head. There's no kettle in room then should take hot water from reception area, sometimes out of water. Anyhow, another manager in next day is more helpful and friendly. Overall, this hotel is good for location (and orange juice in breakfast time) but too expensive for room and service quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MountainsHelen
Reviews.Content: My extended family stayed here for five nights over New Years. All rooms were comfortable although smallish in size. However my daughters family room was very large and able to easily accommodate two adults and two children. They provided a cot for their baby. Bathrooms are modern and a good size. Breakfast was in a large dining area and had plenty of yummy things to choose from. A juicer provided fresh squeezed orange juice and there were a artery of breads to freshly cut. Cereals, yoghurts and of course pastries. Cheese and cold meats too. All very fresh and tasty. Over the road there is a very nice restaurant where we ate three of the nights but there is also a snack food shop where we bought great burgers, wraps and fries the other two nights. There is also a fresh fruit and vege shop over the road. A laundromat is across the street and up four or five shops. We were able to freshen up all our clothes. I must also mention that the Metro is NEXT DOOR!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Brownyorange Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. I think it is really value for money. ItThe location is good, the rooms are good, the breakfast is good, and the staff are good. I have no complaints, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Reed S
Reviews.Content: My brother and I recently stayed at the All Seasons Gare de Est hotel and had a great experience. The price was very reasonable considering it included a wonderful breakfast, free good wi-fi connection and a clean, large room. I found it difficult finding a hotel that actually said " two beds",untill I found this one. The room was large, modern and clean. We were on an upper floor and could easily see the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is right beside the train tracks, but the windows are double pained and we could barley hear the trains. We even left the windows open one night. The breakfast was awesome and included all sorts of fresh bread, cheeses, juices meats and eggs. The location can't be beat. We arrived by the Eurostar train from London and arrived in the Gare de Nord station (also took metro there to Airport) and the hotel is a short 8 min. walk. There is even a metro station about 50' from the front door! Near the hotel on the next street over there are several shops, bakeries, and restaurants. My brother is very hard to please and he loved the hotel! I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone, and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, close to major train stations!”
Reviews.Author: crackerbox838
Reviews.Content: Came from Singapore so we spoke little French but Staff were very kind and attentive. Good breakfast, clean rooms, affordable. we enjoyed the service!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Gare de L'est Chateau Landon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Extremely convenient hotel if taking TGV early the next day to Germany for example. Good choice of restaurants directly across the road. Did not get the "grand lit" we had asked for and given twin beds with no attempt/offer to convert them to a King. Could do with some decorative touches as very plain, basic rooms despite advertising suggesting otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: domingos_soares
Reviews.Content: I stayed only two nights at this hotel. The first room we've got had a very strong odor of cigarette smoke. I called the front desk and promptly we were moved to another room. The room was very well furnished, very clean and could easily accomodate a family of four (we are only three) and still leave enough room for a LOT of luggage. The bathroom is also clean, large and with a large tube. The breakfast is too simple for my taste but this is the norm within many accor hotels (Ibis, formule 1 and all seasons) and I knew it, so no complains here (both my wife and daughter enjoyed it). The subway is (REALLY) next door but the area is not the safest place on earth so we avoided walking there at night. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ZweckmÃ¤ÃŸig”
Reviews.Author: RobertLockwoodJr
Reviews.Content: Zentral gelegen, nur einige Schritte vom Gare de lâ€™Est entfernt, wartet das â€žAll Seasonsâ€œ mit nÃ¼chterner, moderner und zweckmÃ¤ÃŸiger Einrichtung auf. Die Zimmer und Betten haben eine angenehme GrÃ¶ÃŸe, der Fernseher ist ausreichend groÃŸ, die Dusche funktioniert gut und es gibt sogar eine Badewanne. FÃ¼r Businessreisende: es gibt keinen Schreibtisch. Obwohl mein Zimmer auf der Bahnhofseite lag, mit Blick auf die Gleise, funktionierte die LÃ¤rmdÃ¤mmung Ã¼berraschend gut, ich wachte nur fÃ¼r einige Sekunden bei der ersten (sehr gedÃ¤mpften) Lautsprecherdurchsage gegen 5:00 auf um sofort wieder einzuschlafen. Positiv zu vermerken ist das kostenlose WLAN, die Gratisflasche Evian und zwei PÃ¤ckchen mit getrockneten FrÃ¼chten. Ein no frills FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck â€“ Croissants, Baguette, Marmelade, Schinken, KÃ¤se, Cerial â€“ das Ãœbliche, einzige Besonderheit: Orangesaft zum Selberpressen. Die Belegschaft ist freundlich und arbeitet effizient. Am â€žAll Seasonsâ€œ gibt es nicht wirklich etwas auszusetzen, es begeistert aber auch durch nichts. Eine 3+ von mir, wem AtmosphÃ¤re egal ist, wird wohl eine 2- vergeben.

Reviews.Title: “Good price + location”
Reviews.Author: Kendy M
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights between 26th and 30th December, 2011. The location is good cos it is close to bus terminals, and just right next to metro and 2 minutes walk to Gare de l'Est train station. The room is pretty small, and quite noisy if the room is facing the train station. The b'fast is quite OK, the good point is you can squeeze fresh orange juice by yourself, but with limited choice and no hot food at all. Overall speaking, we enjoyed our stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. After a long night flight - we were able to check- in early, which was really nice. The hotel was about a 10 minute walk from Gare du Nord. There is a Metro station right next door, the Metro system was clearly marked for going from place to place. The hotel staff was great! They were all friendly, and helped us figure out how to get around the city and to the different attractions. The rooms are small but comfortable, but who goes to Paris to sit in a hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, if you want a hotel near gare de l' est or gare du midi.The hotel is only 10 meters away from the metro station chateau landon, so it' s very easy to go anywere in paris by metro with safety and very fast.The room is basic,clean and the breakfast very good (the most delicius croissants ). Nothing bad at all , except the noisy elevator.The price was great for this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thekings11
Reviews.Content: If u r after an average hotel away from the main attractions than this is it look no further... Hotel staff were very nice and helpful... Hotel itself is located away from main attractions.. For instance a taxi ride at nite from the tower will cost u 10 euros... It has a metro station right outside which was quite handy... Breakfast quite ordinary....

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was one of the least expensive hotels in Paris when we booked it. For the price we did not expect much but we did expect the room to be clean, especially the bathroom. The bathtub had hair in it and the floor looked grimy...the carpet was dirty too. On a positive note the mattress was very comfortable but there was only a bottom sheet and a comforter...not sure if the comforter is changed between guest (we hope so).

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: rtwelftree Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location if you arrive by eurostar, only a 10 minute walk from Gare du Nord. Next door is a metro station which is great for getting you into the centre quickly. The room was a good size for a Paris hotel but a little tatty. The hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly. Breakfast was very good with a good choice of very fresh pastries etc. Free coffee and water available 24 hours in hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money at top location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a spaciuos family suite with excellent bedding. Although there were some stains on the carpet, the room was very clean overall. The buffet breakfast was very good for a hotel of this category, incl. freshly squeezed orange juice and espresso coffee. The hotel is right next to Gare de l'est and has the metro station Chateau Landon next door, making the hotel a perfect location for a family city break.

Reviews.Title: “Colourful Interior Hides Dull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tallyhos
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and arrived on the Eurostar train at Gare du Nord. The hotel was easy to find and easy to walk to from the train station (with luggage) - 15 minutes maximum. Check in was easy and we asked for a room away from the train station side of the hotel as Gare l'Est is quite busy. We were thankful our room was on the street side of the hotel. We booked a family room, as from previous experience, a lot of hotel rooms in Paris are small. We were not disappointed. We had space to spread out and could walk around the room without bumping into desks, beds or suitcases. It was a shame that the carpet was well overdue for a steam clean/replacement - it had many stains. The bathroom was adequate, but had a linoleum floor. The air-conditioning struggled to work, even at maximum settings. We also had an issue with the cleaning staff on at least two occasions. We put the "do not disturb" sign on our door only to find that it was ignored. The hotel is in a great location to access the Metro Tube Station (Chateau Landon) which gets you close to some major tourist attractions in central Paris. There is a supermarket and a choice of restaurants located nearby. Gare du Nord train station has many eating options with menus in different languages in case your French isn't that great. Breakfast was included in the price but we found it got boring after the first couple of days. Check out was easy but at no time were we asked how we enjoyed our stay. Overall, the hotel was adequate, but we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in Paris North”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good place for the tourists at an affordable price. Good ambiance and free breakfast. Courtesy for visitors with free water and tea/coffee in the reception. Free Wi-fi , Very clean and spacious suite rooms for family Only concern is parking for guests with Car

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay for one dat in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mealypied69000
Reviews.Content: We arrived by Eurostar from London on Tuesday 13 September for a one night stay in Paris on our way to Italy. We chose this hotel as it was near to Gare de Nord station within easy walking distance. We had a room that overlooked the3station platforms of Gare fe Est that was interesting to see all the trains leaving and arriving from the 8th floor. If you do not like the sound of trains then there is no noise with the hotel room window closed. The service is good, the buffet breakfast is quite good and we enjoyed our one night stay

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hobe
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very good - Near station by train and metro. Rooms are clean with nice working Ac but quite small like Paris style. Breakfast with good choice different breads etc. Lot of bars and restaurants near. Also little shop which is open till 3 am. Good hotel if you stay in this part of Paris

Reviews.Title: “Fun in paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel. Easy walk from both Gare du Nord and Gare de L'est even with luggage. Included breakfast was great deal - nice fresh pastries and good choices. Loved that when I came back late there was both a reception person and security in the lobby making sure I belonged there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - good location - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: dizzylizzie55
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with everything you need. Clean and modern rooms and bathrooms which look like they've recently been refurbished. Excellent breakfast with good choice of bread, pastries, cereal, fruit and yoghurt. Free tea and coffee available throughout the day and free unlimited wi-fi. Friendly English-speaking staff. Good location - 5 minute walk from Gare du Nord so convenient for travelling to/from the airport and Eurostar. There is a Metro station next door to the hotel which takes you to central Paris and all of the sights/tourist spots in 10-15 minutes. Lots of shops, cafes and restaurants nearby. Would highly recommend and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice !”
Reviews.Author: Familytravels0709
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in a family room with our 11 and 14 year old children. Large, comfortable, clean room with adjustable AC/heat. Although next to metro station and two train stations, the room was very quiet. Good sized closet. Breakfast certainly a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: N N
Reviews.Content: - Excellent location, Chateau Landon Metro Station is under the hotel building (but you do not hear any noise from trains). Gare de L'est is 5-10 minutes walk. - Room was very clean. - Standard Continental Breakfast included in price. - Many food joints and shops nearby. We used Franprix supermarket. - Luggage storage facility available. - Check in/ check out was smooth. Svetlana, the lady on reception, was very courteous, polite and spoke fluent English. - We had read comments about air-conditioning not working, but this wasn't a problem during our stay. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Close to transport links - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: disayshi
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the beginning of August, with our two kids aged 14 & 12. Rooms clean & tidy and more room than I expected. Beds large & very comfortable. Also had a bath with shower over it. Breakfast was plentiful no matter when we went down. But agree with other reveiws a variation each day would be nice. Same yogurt, cereal & fruit (banana) every day. Staff helpful & friendly. Our room overlooked the large train station next door (26 platforms that I counted) But pleased to say never heard any trains at all. The Chateau London metro is directly next door - same line as Louvre. Gard de Nord (eurostar & airport express line) Is a easy flat 8 min walk away. There is a mini mart across the road, & a good bar/restuarant (my husband watched wales v england rugby)Also a laundrette about 2 mins walk. Water pressure on 7th floor not that good. Would stay again - kids happy with it

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 night stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is just above Gare du l/East rails, but with good isolation hotel doesn't suffer of any noise. It has very good conenction by underground metro and buses to centre of the city but also with the Charl De Gaul airport where we came from. Family Room we had was very clean, felt relly new, bed was huge, and kids beds were big single beds. The double windows did good isolation from noise and on 6th floor was very quite. Daily room service - changed towels, grabage, and 2 new water bottles Evian. There was walk in wardrobe, lots of space, TV, table and 4 chairs. Good aircondition, perfectly mounted so it doesn't blow into any of beds. We had included buffet breakfast and that was marevlous, CROASAINTS, JUST BAKED, AND FRENCH BAGET STICK, choice of cerials, machine to squeeze your orange juice, EVIAN WATER, cheese salamy, yogurts. dinign room very clean and modern. There was area for kids to play on computers, and lounge with magazines, computer for free internet, Coffe machines and water in loby and dining room. Overall very pleasnt feeling in hotel. Outlook from where we could see top of the Eifell Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean inexpensive hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfy room, it was a bit on the small side but nice nonetheless. Staff were friendly and helpful and rooms were cleaned daily. As for location, there's no major attractions in the immediate vicinity but the Chateau Landon metro stop is literally just outside the hotel which will take you anywhere in Paris for 1.70E. The hotel is also right next to Gare de l'est station and a 5min walk from Gare du Nord, which is handy if you are travelling by Eurostar. Don't be put off that the hotel is right next to a train station, the double glazed windows mean that you don't hear a thing in the rooms. We also had breakfast included in our stay and it was very nice with fresh warm baguettes, ham, cheese, cereal, fruit juices, yoghurts etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Gard Du Nord”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel for 1 night prior to getting a train out of Gard Du Nord which is an easy 10 minute walk away. A Family suite consisted of one enormoue double and two singles plus a table & 4 chairs. OK for a night but not any longer. The restaurant opposite was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “All Seasons Paris East Station”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very basic. A double bed, two sofa beds and a table but very clean. For us the attraction here was that we could get one room for the entire family and it was only two minutes walk to the East Train Station. Very handy when you are carrying the luggage for three people. There is also a Metro stop right next to the hotel. The neighborhood was nothing special but there were decent resteraunts nearby and there was not much street noise. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: VEK_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the end of April with my mother-in-law. Reserved through HRS, the price for a twin with breakfast was little less than 100 euros. It turned out to be a good choice for a short city-break: near Gare de l'Est and Gare du Nord (where the train from the airport arrives), and the Chateau Landon metro station is right next to the hotel. Room was clean, bathroom also, and the breakfast was enough to get us started (coffee, juice, bread, yoghurt...). The service could have been quicker - be prepared to queue at the reception. Anyhow, I'd still recommend All Seasons if you want a decent and centrally located place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious”
Reviews.Author: SydneyEuroTrip Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel room was huge for a family of four. Breakfast nice small variety but found it was the standard in Europe. Staff were fantastic Metro was next door and very cose to main train station as we caught train to Germant from Paris. Close to laundry just across the room and restaurant across road fantastic food and service really enjoyed our stay at this hotel would stay again. Felt very safe staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Cycling Trip”
Reviews.Author: ipswich78
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by friendly staff. We were able to store our bikes in a locked room. The rooms were clean and bright. The location was perfect as their were many restaurants in the area and we were close to both stations. The highlight of the hotel was the helpful staff. One of my fellow cyclists managed to drop his passport in a gap in the lift. It dropped to the base of the lift. The staff organised for an Engineer to be called very quickly as we were due to leave that day. We were advised that a 76 euro charge was applicable for the Engineer to be called out. This was waved by the Manager. I have nothing but praise for all the staff who assisted us during our stay. Breakfast was also very nice good selection and plenty of it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great breakfast but not so safe area...”
Reviews.Author: iloveamerica83
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in this hotel with my husband. The hotel was new and clean and its design was nice and modern. The room was small but it is enough for a couple. The bathroom was clean. The breakfast was great, there was a lot of choice : bread, croissants, cheese, cereals, juices... The staff wasn't very nice, they didn't seem to take their job seriously. We didn't feel very safe in the Gare de l'Est area especially at night. I wouldn't recommend this area to a single woman. An area like Saint-Germain-des-Pres for example is safer I think. The AC wasn't working, it was so hot at night, I felt like we were sleeping in an oven. I was taking showers in the middle of the night to cool myself down so I would say the sleep quality in this hotel was very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Days...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. The nearest metro station is just outside the front door of the hotel - with a direct service to central paris. The room was a good size, with a table and chairs for four. The room was clean, nicely decorated and quiet at night. Breakfast room was busy at 9:00am but not crowded. Fresh orange juice, and a good range of breads, pastries and cereals. Would stay here again the next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Solid place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dlittle58
Reviews.Content: Pros: very clean; helpful staff; great French breakfast- had croissants, ham, cheese, baguettes, cereal, orange juicers, cappuccino machine, yogurt, and tea, water, and coffee; also the breakfast is available from 6:30 to 11:00 which was great for us; location was good- a five minute walk to two metro and train stations, free mineral water and tea all day Cons: room was very small; many employees did not speak English well; not a ton of French restaurants or cafes in the area; to get to any monuments you are a 15 min metro ride away; also an hour from Orly airport Side note- not a big deal to many but there was only one tv channel in English (BBC world news) we did not spend much time in the hotel room but one night we weren't feeling well and called it early and did not even bother to turn it on Overall, I recommend this hotel, especially to English or American tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for solo travellers.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really close to two big tain stations and is close to a Hop On Hop Off bus stop. The hotel rooms are spacious and clean and very affordable for a solo traveller looking for a decent hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just outside the gare de est this hotel is an optimum locaTION FOR TRAVELLING BY FOOT OR WITH THE METRO, HAD A GREAT time breakfast was fab! Wouls definetly recomment it to others. Although close to the station their is no noise polution, beds addequately comfy. Tea and coffee readilyavailable throughout the day good idea!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny,clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: PortugueseLullaby
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms but clean and free internet. Just for sleepping or for business. Metro station and restaurants, including fast-food just in from of it. Very good surprise.

Reviews.Title: “beyond appearance”
Reviews.Author: smagnab
Reviews.Content: The Hotel "seems" new but is not well maintained. Our room was small and there was a very bad smell due to the moquettte/carpet which was not so clean. Apparently it looks rather nice but if you look at detail, that's something else...Not so clean. Breakfast is ok. The location is good as it is very near the Metro Station. The rooms are not so quite if you leave the windows open as it's stuck to the a Train Station "Gare de l' Est". The employees/receptionist are rather nice, apart of the young manager which was in our case kind, has we required to have a special receipt for the company as our trip was half business/tourist purpose. A positive hint: excellent WiFi connection!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ivan_002_10
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, the main door of the hotel is the next door of the entry to the metro station. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Free breakfast is good with lot of breads and pastries and possibility of freshly squeezed orange juice. Free coffee and tea machine in the lobby of the hotel is also great. The negative is that the room is small and there is no wardrobe in the room .

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located for Eurostar travelers.”
Reviews.Author: vallabhprabhu
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Paris by Eurostar and you have limited budget, than this is a right hotel for you. Will take around 12 minutes to walk from Nord station to this place. Rooms are good, but when were staying, the air-conditioning unit was was either not working or the hotel does not have cooling unit. It was so hot that we could not sleep the whole night. Opening of windows was not the solution because of the noise of the vehicles. Don't expect anything extra for breakfast as the same is just for a budget traveller. Indian travelers can find a Indian restaurant just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Easter vacations in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. The overall stay at this hotel was fine but the only problem was that Air-conditioning was not working at all for first 2 nights of our stay, after complaining 6-7 times someone finally came to check at our room and then we were told that the central air-conditioning has been turned on just the same day we arrived and it takes at least 24 hrs for it to take effect which was rubbish, as the hotel should be aware that after mid April it is hot in paris and we arrived on April 23. Except this our stay was ok. The hotel is situated very very close to Metro, which is a big +. There are lots of good restaurants around and we also cherished food at an indian restaurant just opposite to hotel..

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: steffie228982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and we were quite happy the room was quite large next to other hotel rooms in paris, The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Breakfast was very good with a large variety but typical french containing alot of breads and pastries. The location was perfect since as soon as you exit the main door of the hotel the next door is the entry to the metro station, which made it extremely easy to travel around. The staff were very nice however what bothered us was that they didn't understand english very well so sometimes it made it very difficult to communicate. When we visited they were making some refurbishing on the top floor and there was quite a few noise going on but it only bothered me since I was sick for the last 2 days of our trip and had to spend them in the hotel room. Over all its a very nice and good hotel and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean hotel, centrally located in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ttaylo3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 42 students on a school trip. This hotel overlooks Gare de l'Est's tracks but surprisingly the windows are well insulated, and train noise is not an issue. Higher floor rooms can view the Eiffel Tower and Sacre Coure. Neighbourhood has small cafes, a small grocery store and kebab shops. Rooms are small, but if you're not planning on spending much time there, why worry?

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with some downside!”
Reviews.Author: rcj957 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice here in last couple of weeks ,the first for two nights one 1st floor facing street no noise from street was very quiet . the second time room 511 if you get this room "move" the bed is less than a metre from the noisy passage and you hear every door shut and people talking when returning to their room .and during my stay this floor had a group of noisy students from the the usa so this didnt help....511 means no sleep! The positives are free internet to your room the location close to Gard du Nord /Gare l'est and next door to Chateau Landon metro. The breakfast was good value for a continental breakfast. This is a good budget hotel. small rooms friendly and helpful staff. beware that this hotel is ussually fully booked.and i would return here.

Reviews.Title: “SO WORTH IT!”
Reviews.Author: MKTH2001
Reviews.Content: this was a wonderful hotel in a great location! very comfortable beds and enough pillows! the hotel is within walking distance of the metro, with children and luggage in tow. breakfast is a typical French breakfast with lots of bread, but enough of it to fill up on and get you through to lunch. the freshly squeezed OJ was a nice little treat. the look of the hotel is very nice and very clean. our room was amazingly large with two extra beds for our children we didn't feel like we were sleeping on top of each other. it even had enough space for our children to feel like they had their "own space" to play. the price that was offered was a great deal for a great place. would defiantly stay again if i ever went back to paris

Reviews.Title: “All seasons”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stay was quite nice, location very good. Only problem was with a-club status features. I was not able to do late check out (as Platinium customer I have such previlage) because desk stuff said there is no possibility to check out late due to fully booked hotel and no cleaning stuff after 12pm. I was very disapointed because I had to change my plans for last day of visit in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: madmuncie
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from Paris and stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and can honestly say there were no problems whatsoever. The rooms are quite basic, but were kept spotlessly clean by the maids and you have a big lcd tv in the wall with BBC news for English speaking guest and one of the other channels had movies in English with French subtitles. There was always hot water any time of the day we used the shower and the room was well insulated for sound, as we were facing onto the very busy Gare L'est railway station and were never disturbed at night at all by the trains. Breakfast in the hotel was lovely and as it was available from 6.30 to 11am, you could go down at your leasure. We had breakfast at 3 different times on each of our days and we had no problems getting a seat. The food itself is plentiful, with a selection of breads, croissants, cereals, yoghurt, cheese, ham and fruit. Basically a typical continental breakfast, but everything was fresh and restocked as it was used. You could also squeeze your own orange juice and there was unlimited tea and coffee, which you could also take out in disposable cups. The hotel also provide coffee until 10pm which you can drink in or take away as you liked. All the staff we spoke to were polite and helpful and spoke English, though I would suggest that anyone who can speak a little French to have a go, it is appreciated, and my French is very basic. People who have complained that they don't speak English should remember that they are infact in France, the language of which is French! The location of the hotel was ideal for a visit to the city, as it is 5mins walk from the main stations for the eurostar and from Charles du gaul airport. I can recommend using the L'open tour to get around the city, as they have stops at both train stations and you can hop on and off at your leasure at all the main attractions of Paris. We used the tour to go back to the hotel to drop off shopping, grabbed a coffee and hopped on the next bus easily. You can also walk to the city centre if your feeling energetic, we walked to notre dame in around 40mins. All in all I have no complaints at all and would recommend the all seasons as an ideal base for a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: AnotherPaddyOnTour
Reviews.Content: The All Seasons is central and next to Gare de l'Est metro and within 5 minutes walking distance of Gare du Nord. The is another All Seasons in front of the Gare du Nord so be sure to get the directions correct. There are a few restaurants and shops nearby for groceries and alcohol. The rooms are typical of Parisian hotels. Small and compact. It has a table and 2 chairs and a tv in the room. This hotel offers excellent value for money. The breakfast is continential and very filling. All you can eat. The french sticks, pain au chocolat and croissants with ham and cheese were perfect for me. Fresh juices and coffee also. If you expect the Four Seasons hotel then pay for it, don't book here then complain that it's not the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable low budget hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Michelle1373
Reviews.Content: Whatever you look, All Seasons Chateau Landon is a low budget hotel. Don`t expect any kind of luxurious amenities or services. The location is good, just below the metro station Chateau Landon, so all the Paris attractions are easy to reach (8 short metro station to Louvre - 15 minutes). One side of the hotel is on the street, and the other side is on the Railway Station. We had a room facing the street, not the railway station, and I can say that in 5 nights I never hear some outside sound during the night, so the rooms are well insulated. There are some small restaurants and supermarkets just near the hotel. The room was not smaller than other hotels - no minibar and other amenities, just the bed (comfortable), some shelves (enough for two persons), a small table, two chairs and a safety box. Since the sheets were clean and in good condition, I cannot say the same thing about the towels... bring your own from home. Also the ventilation hole in bathroom was full of dust. But in rest, the room and bathroom were clean. The breakfast was ok ( a nice surprise was the orange press for fresh juice) - 2 kinds of fruits, cheese and ham, fresh baguette, croissants, butter, jam, honney, yogurt, cereals, milk, coffee and tea. The wireless internet is free of charge, also there is a water dispenser and hot water dispenser, tea and coffee available for free in the hotel lobby between 11.00 am and 10.00 pm. The hotel is kids frendly, you can find some toys in the kids corner and some special kids meal in the breakfast choices.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, very good value”
Reviews.Author: yippee3343
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was well stocked and generous. Endless coffee, good ham/cheese, fresh orange juice and loads of cereals and bakery goods. Staff very helpful, provided eggs and cooked porrige (we provided) with politeness. Rooms reasonably clean, bathrooms nice and clean. Central, right on the Metro, and excellent value for money, if taken with a Eurorail ticket. Why do people moan so much? No fuss, great stay, no frills, good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, every inch of it”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All Seasons is a range of budget hotel so do not expect too much. I have stayed in other hotels with similar room rates, I must admit that the overall quality in general is bit better. I asked for a double room but got a twin. The hotel staff was unhelpful and rude while checking in - maybe due to stress as it was a busy time. Location is good, next to Chateau Landon metro station and 5 mins by walk from Gare du Nord.

Reviews.Title: “POOR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Would not come back to this hotel, terrible service - poor english front desk and room service. When you ask for something it is like you shouldn't bother them at all. Toilet not clean got hair in the bath tub! Carpet not vacumn clean I am sure - some biscuits pieces my son left there for the whole few nights.

Reviews.Title: “nice location with lots of restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Mel88Lee Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: hotel was a 5 mins walk from Nord Station and its beside Metro ChÃ¢teau-Landon... great point to make trips out... Breakfast was good for kids.. and the snacks for kids was a nice little thing

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER BEEN TERRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: frenchisajoke
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome, London and Paris during December 2010 and stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. What could be worst than: 1) running out of hot water in shower in less than 10 mins??? wtf? 2) no heater when it was -5 degrees during the deep winter i got a cold immediately. I asked the front desk and they don't understand wtf! 3) no hot water provided in the room. There is only a tiny 4 litres hot water boiler to service the whole hotel with hundreds of room and staff doesn't care when there is no more hot water (i asked 3 nights and i was so sick need some hot water for my lemip cold and flu). I asked nicely the staff just say finished at 10pm and he goes away while i saw the boiler just dumped behind the front desk. I said I am very sick and he right answer me "I do not care". 4) Front desk don't speak good english 5) Room service need to come and clean the room at 12pm (even though we put out the sign do not disturb) and i asked her to come back in an hour she kept saying no no no. Man it is my holiday and we are staying for few nights not checking out! 6) The room next to me got a few guys taking drugs at night and thrown up badly on the 2nd floor lobby. Security only deal with the matter the next morning. 7) Bath tower got dark spots not clean???? wtf??? All in all, DO NOT COME TO THIS HOTEL. VERY POOR SERVICE. There is a Hotel IBIS not far away from here should really go there instead.

Reviews.Title: “a fun-styled hotel offering excellent location and quality for low cost”
Reviews.Author: geoffthewinger
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel when our original booking with another hotel fell through. They responded quickly to our urgent need for a room and honoured the original price quoted from the other hotel. The room was small and relatively basic, but stylish and cheerful. The beds were large and comfortable, and the room was very quiet. The bathroom was fine, good shower and wash basin. Breakfast was fine. A self-serve buffet with plenty of food and a juicer for making fresh orange juice. The location is good too. The hotel is directly adjacent to a Metro station, 5 mins walk from the Gare de l'Est and 10 mins walk from the Gare du Nord. There is a bistro directly opposite, but we fancied a walk, so went to la Grille, a wonderful little restaurant about 15 mins walk and easy to find. Would definitely stay here again, for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleggyCornwall
Reviews.Content: This All Seasons hotel is at the lower end of the Accor Group's range of hotels, but as the price of accommodation in Paris has risen dramatically in the last few years, it is reasonable for a short break holiday. We just wanted to have 4 nights to visit the Monet exhibition and other museums. The rooms are functional and clean and like all Accor hotels we have stayed in, the matresses are very comfortable. The price includes as much as you can eat breakfast. The breakfast area was clean and continuously well stocked with a very wide range of food and drinks. The Chateau Landon All Seasons hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the Eurostar at the Gare du Nord ,and is adjacent to the Chateau Landon Metro entrance and close to the Gare de l'Est main line station. There are many buses from the area in front of the Gare de l'Est and by purchasing a three day Visit Pass we were able to use both buses and metro and RAPT trains without having to search for coins. The hotel does not have a restaurant but there are many in the area near both mainline stations. There are also many local small food shops in the road directly opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very Nice Stay along with excellent breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: akiblah
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four days and it was quite at that cost.Breakfast was delicious and the staff was quite friendly.Not speaking french was not a problem here as most of their staff were comfortable speaking in english.Overall it was a wonderfull stay at that cost.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Will Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: bmoregirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two days and had a wonderful time. The staff was able to check us in early and our room was quite large for European standards. The room was very clean and bright. The shower had good pressure. There was a complimentary bottle of water in our room. The window faced the street but we did not have much noise inside the room. The breakfast was wonderful and had variety. The hotel also offers spring water and coffee all day long, which is nice for refilling water bottles. There is free wifi and a computer in the lobby, but only one. It is extremely convenient to stay at this hotel as Gare de L'Est is only a few minutes walk and just outside the door of the hotel is the metro station Chateau Landon. Overall, this hotel was wonderful from beginning to end. Will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: pacheco692
Reviews.Content: i loved every second, the people who work there are amazing, especially thomas. He was very helpful, very kind, and he spoke pretty good english, which again was very helpful. All in all had an amazing time, and an amazing stay at bercy all seasons hotel

Reviews.Title: “A true Parisian Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: amak4u
Reviews.Content: Delightful cheery hotel situated in a quiet residential part of the city, handy to all conveniences such as supermarkets, restaurants and wine, cheese, meat delis. There is a cycle rank and Metro line beneath the property and short walks to Gare du Nord & l'Est and buses. Free wifi is a bonus and breakfast though limited in choice is plentiful. Friendly informed and attentive staff made it a pleasant stay. Offers all the joys of staying in Paris without a high price tag. A hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant discovery”
Reviews.Author: slowmd
Reviews.Content: Very good location right next to metro chateau-landon, complimentary bottle of evian water, free wifi and adequate breakfast. If there's a kettle and fridge in the room it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, just beside the Metro Station, and is perfect for Families!”
Reviews.Author: fayesim
Reviews.Content: This All Seasons hotel is just beside the Chateau Landon Metro Station, so it makes it very convenient for families with children. It is also near (about 10 mins leisure walk) to the Gare Du Nord RER train station which allows u to travel to the Paris CDG airport easily. This hotel provides free WIFI so is great for me to upload photos using my handphone. There is also a computer with internet service in the lobby. There is a family corner where hot / cold water is provided, so u can refill your bottles easily, since paris mineral water is not cheap. The hotel is kind enough to provide us with an extra bed for our small children, since the family rooms were fully booked. Free breakfast was also provided for the us as well as for the children too. Children were given a goodies bag which has fun activities book to keep them occupied. When I requested for a photocopy service, the staff did it for me free of charge too. The hotel also provided the guest with some nice tidbits free of charge. Opposite the hotel there are some shops which sell groceries and food. We tried the Kebab in one of the shops, and is nice and cheap. Only 5 euros for a big kebab with lots of french fries. Great for supper... Overall the stay is great!! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: randywood1981
Reviews.Content: Rooms weren't the biggest, but was ample and very clean. Bed was very comfy and the shower was fantastic. Breakfast was really good, could have used some more hot foods though, like toast or eggs. Lots of yogurts, cereals, jams, pastries and hot beverages. Fresh fruits as well. Location was just fine by us, every thing was close by thanks to the station being right there. Nothing was more than 20 minutes away except for Versailles. Our room faced the street and noise was never an issue being on the 5th floor, the other side of the hotel faces the train station though, not sure how much noise came through to those rooms. Staff were not the friendliest, but they weren't unfriendly. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but still is an economy hotel”
Reviews.Author: toyotaboy95
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be a Mercure (see past reviews and covered up Mercure signs in rooms), thus explains the relatively high number of rooms and spaciousness. Be aware that there are no toothbrushes, toothpaste and slippers provided, so bring your own. A questionable batch of shampoo / body wash (multi-use) formulas in different colours (brand colours - blue and orange - of all seasons), decided not to use them. Welcome gifts (two bottles of Evian and 3 packs of Ricola) were given a few minutes after settling down, a nice touch. Beds are very spacious but the only English channel available was BBC World News (they have Disney and National Geographic but in French). Welcome guide stated there was CNN, but was unable to locate the channel. The "anti-stress pillows" make it almost impossible to sleep and was tossing and turning all night, way too soft. Bicycle rentals opposite to the hotel and location to metro is outstanding, to the right of the all seasons entrance. Breakfast downstairs was quite good and as written in the previous review, there were two electric fresh orange juice makers with oranges provided beside the juice-makers (in addition to orange juice, apple juice, milk available). However, beds were a bit dirty (found human hair on the linens) and staff did not give the children's welcome gifts to us. Also be aware that water can easily spill out of the bath tub when showering (no curtains) and that you have to create a free account to use the wi-fi (enter username/password) everytime. One PC connected to internet available in lobby. Saw that many people (esp. Japanese tours) and Asian families stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed, sound-proof and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: smartnik
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews, I was a bit apprehensive about this hotel. However, it did not only live up to my expectations but greatly exceeded them. Location-wise it worked as a charm. We arrived at the Gare de l'Est and the hotel was just behind it, very close to metro lines 4 and 7 that take you anywhere in Paris. In fact, the Chateau Landon station is almost in the same building as is the hotel. There are a few fruit stands around and a supermarket (Franprix) on the street behind the traffic lights. Rooms are well-appointed, all white (see my pictures) and large by Parisian standards. Windows are completely soundproof: we were on the 7th floor and could not hear the street below. Yes, windows can be opened. The bathroom features a real bath tub, not just a shower stall. Bed was large and comfortable to sleep in. Public areas are clean, welcoming, colourful and nicely decorated in a minimalist designer style. There is free Wi-Fi connection in the rooms and a public computer in the lobby. Finally, the breakfast was really-really good and plentiful. Good quality ham and cheese, a selection of cereals, jam, bread, butter, fresh fruit. I was impressed to see a basket of oranges and two electric juice-makers so you could make your own fresh orange juice. All in all, for the price we paid (85 euros through their own web-site), it was an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Anticipated”
Reviews.Author: scalette
Reviews.Content: We like to stay in the Canal St Martin area when visiting Paris as it is a away from the main tourist centre but with good public transport links. We decided to try a different hotel this time and had read favourable reviews of this hotel. It is a modern chain hotel so we knew more or less what to expect but of its type it is very good. That there was small table and seats was a bonus and the bathroom was more spacious than we expected. Our room was very quiet even though it overlooked a busy road and on the 5th floor we were far away from any rumblings from the metro. Breakfast (inclded in the price) provided suffient choice and decent coffee and being able to pick up a free cup of coffee in the foyer was always welcome after a day outdoors. For any railway enthusiasts, the back of the hotel overlooks the platforms and bridges of the Gare de l'Est, a magnificent sight even without the trains!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with extras”
Reviews.Author: Annual_travel
Reviews.Content: We spen a week in Paris staying at All Seasons Chateau Landon. The location of the hotel is excellent - right next to Gare de l'Est (which we took the train from there to Reims for a day trip - very nice!), 10 min walk from Gare de Nord (which makes arriving in Paris from the airport convinent) & 30 steps (literally - we counted) from the Chateau Landon metro station. We had a triple room with 3 twin bed - which is considered very spacious in Europe - the decor are modern. I really like the big tub in the bathroom. The room is pretty clean. We faced the train station and at times we could hear the train at night - but that didn' bother us too much. Breakfast, WIFI, tea & coffee during the day are all included in the price of the hotel. The hotel is pretty family friendly - it has a little corner in the lobby for young children which my daughter had to go every morning - while my husband and I enjoyed our coffee. The only negative is the lack of a fridge in the room to store my daughter's milk. But there is a fridge in the reception area and they gladly store the milk for us (I am sure there were quite a number of family with young children staying there as there were a few bottles of milk in the fridge). Also, the elevators are quite slow and at times were not working (however the elevators are huge - again in European standard). I think it's a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Nice Service”
Reviews.Author: Zanioculcas
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel for a week. Staff were very friendly and rooms were very clean. The modern rooms were cosy but they meet our needs including internet connection (although not always able to connect), air-condition and TV. Breakfast was fine with a number of healthy options available, including yoghurts, fruit, cereals and toast - I think its a bonus that no English breakfast is served, why must we always eat more calories when we are on holiday!!!. Receptionist was always in attendance and always greeted us with a smile. Gare de L'Est is just next door and Gare de' Nord is only a short walking distance (8min) away, so in a matter of 20 min you can arrive in Paris. The restaurants in front of Gard de' Nord were great. For those who like Chinese food there is a great Chinese place just in front of the main gates. In front of your hotel there is a little grocer for those who want to pick up a snack. Was initially worried about the noises from the trains, but slept like a log, although I must say we were given a room on the street side. So try booking on the street side so as not to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: allywooo
Reviews.Content: Well to sum up this hotel experience it was less than good. Here's why... Positives: * Close to Chateau London Metro entrance, great for quick access to seeing the sights * Breakfast included which was alright (Breakfast staff was friendly!) *Wi Fi in rooms, computer in the lobby * A room to store your luggage in after checkout if needed * Rooms were generally clean (housekeeping staff also friendly!) *Suprisingly quiet since it is next to a trainstation Negatives: * Being a front desk receptionist myself I know how important it is that guest service needs to be top notch. These guys here were NOT! * Gentleman at checkin was very slow at getting us checked in (we had two rooms and the second one wasn't even in their system) They did accomodate us with our room types but he was not friendly to us at all. *I called down asked if someone spoke English, the girl responded yes, I asked if there was a vending machine to get a chocolate bar, she didn't understand, I explained 3 times what I wanted and she responded " I don't know what you're saying?" So used what little french I knew and she finally said no, there is no vending machine. *At checkout the same front desk agent who checked us in, checked us out still in an unfriendly manner and when we wanted to store our luggage he acted like it was an inconveince! * I assume she was the breakfast manager and she showed us where to sit at breakfast but when we wanted to sit somewhere else it was like a 'okay fine be that way' type attitude. * On room cleanliness - there were some small black hairs I found around the bathtub which I believe to be a little gross. *No alarm clocks in room but they do have an alarm system on the phone or you could call the front desk. These negatives outweighed the positives and made it so that we will probably never come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: youngswiss
Reviews.Content: this hotel is perfect if you arrive at the gare de l'est in paris. you can even take the subway at the end of the platforms an get DIRECTLY to the entrance of the hotel. we stayed 4 days and felt very comfortable for the price we payed. for 60â‚¬ per room we got a small but appropriate room (normally in paris the rooms are a lot smaller!) with flatscreen tv, safe, air condition (which didn't really cool down, but was ok) and a lot of ports to connect the laptop, ipod and else to the tv. the free internet worked well with my laptop and was even quite fast, comparing with other free internet providers. expecting a rather small bathroom we were really surprised about what we got. it was almost the size of the bedroom, clean and modern and had even a bathtub. we expected some noise from the train station and street, but the windows were perfectly soundproof, we didn't even hear any neighbours! the breakfast-buffet was also well equipped and as there were a lot of tables to sit we never had to "fight" for a sitting place as we already experienced in other places. they also offer free water and tea during the day. for our last day we could also let our luggage in their storage-room to enjoy our last hours in paris without carying a suitcase around. we warmly recommend this hotel for who wants to pay not too much for a room, but have a minimum of comfort and cleanliness, which you wouldn't find in a backpackers-hostel. and forget the idea of a hotel in the middle of the towncentre like le mairais or quartier latin. it's only busy, noisy and the hotels are very small and filthy. you have much more comfort with the hotel next to your arrival-station. once arrived you cruise around with your VÃˆLIB for 1â‚¬/day and discover the most beautyful places. taking the mÃ©tro you will see anything but the subways of paris.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting budget option from Accor”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located next to Chateau Landon metro station on line 7, but within a 2-3 min walk of the Gare De l'Est and 10 min walk from Gare Du Nord. This hotel used to be operated under the Mercure brand but Accor have re-branded this under their All Seasons brand. First impressions of the reception area are good, the ground floor area has been totally renovated and updated. Funky colours and a so called conviviality corner with free internet access, free tea and coffee, selection of newspapers and magazines and also a childrens play area. Unfortunately when you get into the lift and to each of the floors, you will discover that the hotel is currently a work in progress as the communal areas on each floor have yet to be done up and the rooms, whilst they have been refreshed, it is more a downgrade to a 2 star property as it is more in line where All Seasons hotels sit as a brand, which is below a Mercure, but above an Ibis. Was allocated room 725 which was at the end of the corridor and well away from the lift as requested and to be honest this was a lovely room, quiet with no noise from surrounding rooms, and high enough to get a good views from the window of the parisian rooftops towards the 19th and 20th districts. Room itself is a little on the small side, but benefit from flatscreen TV, ample storage space, in room safe, air conditioning (which was not working too well) Blackout curtain, and ports for connecting laptops to the Flatscreen TV, I Pod and various other audio/video equipment. Bathroom was an ok size for a Paris hotel with shower/tub. Wi Fi is included for free at this hotel and was able to access the net without any problems, only niggle was that the safe is not big enough to store a laptop. Noise from surrounding rooms was pratically non-existant in this particular room, although beware with some rooms which face the Gare De L'Est as you will hear trains arriving and departing. The beds are very comfortable, slept like a baby with the windows open all night and being high up in central Paris, street noise was not too much of an issue. Nice touch was a bottle of water on arrival, although it was a shame they did not provide this for subsequent night stays. Big plus is the breakfast in the morning, nothing too fancy however it was nice to have this included in all room rates. Selction of fresh croissants, pain au chocolat, orange juice, bread, cheese, ham, cereals and youghurts Overall considering this chain is of a similar standard to the Ibis chain which Accor also operates, I was quite impressed with the hotel and with the extras and certainly could not grumble at the 59 Euro a night rate which I paid. If paying around this rate, I would most definately return and recommend to others!

HotelInfo.Name: All Seasons Paris Gare de l'Est Chateau Landon
HotelInfo.Address: 1-3 rue Chateau Landon, 75010 Paris, France
